website_summaries.verdict: Hardly larger than a Tic Tac case, and rated at 100 lumens, the 3-ounce Philips Pocket Projector PPX4010 is an excellent laptop companion for deskside presentations.
pros: LED light source lasts the life of the projector
cons: AC power adapter is an extra-cost option
Connecting to phones or tablets requires a separate connection for power

customer_reviews.title: Very good with laptop (after proper setup)
customer_reviews.text: We bought the projector to watch videos. It took a while to figure out how to launch it, but we enjoy it now. For proper connection I would suggest new users to follow the instructions strictly (otherwise won't work). You may need to buy additional cables if the standard ones don't work with your laptop. For sound, go to Start>Control Panel>Sound>Playback tab. Select "Speakers" as the default audio playback device. We didn't need any additional drivers/applications to run it.
customer_reviews.author: Viktoria

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great vaule product, very good entry level project for personal use as well.
customer_reviews.author: Veer Pratap Singh

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent piece of equipment, absolutely perfect for mobile presentation purposes. I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: loose usb port meant a return.
customer_reviews.text: Not very well built, had to return the projector due to the usb port coming loose and pushed back into the body of the unit rendering it unusable. Until then the projector worked fine and was actually pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I live in a small flat and didn't want to spend a lot on an unnecessarily large projector, so this is a nice solution at an affordable price. It is a bit noisy, but otherwise this is a nifty little device.
customer_reviews.author: Vicente C. Salazar

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product for the price. Very pleased with image quality and ease of use.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M.

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight bit of kit
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these that had been returned because the previous user claimed it was noisy. But I found It quiet and effective, great value for such a tiny projector it gives good quality so convenient to use a battery pack and connect to my iPad. Or directly charged from MacBook Pro. Impressive piece of kit, it's a good backup for small meetings if no access to a projector.
customer_reviews.author: On2wheels

customer_reviews.title: Great product, shame I cant make it work with Windows 10
customer_reviews.text: Great mini product and quality of projection, however, I've tried every which way to connect it to my lenovo yoga laptop running windows 10 and I can't make the two talk. the advice I got from the seller was in general for projectors, which I use a lot for work in any case so I'm familiar with trouble shooting projection issues. So I'm forced to conclude that this product doesn't work with windows 10. Such a shame because it's a great looking pocket sized product
customer_reviews.author: Kym

customer_reviews.title: No tripod lets it down.
customer_reviews.text: Nice little projector just a shame they couldn't supply the tripod which you need and a little case with it. I would have thought for that price it would have all been included.
customer_reviews.author: BNG Training

customer_reviews.title: Really that good
customer_reviews.text: Wow wow wow. Worth every penny. Great picture. Amazing truly everything you could want from a projector in something the size of a cigarette packet. Anyone who buys this will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: DANIEL
